DataElement.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Whole Body Diffusion-Weighted Imaging Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation._Executed and carried through to completion._A non-ionizing radiation imaging modality for quantitative assessment of disease burden and therapy response. WB-DWI uses the apparent diffusion coefficient (ADC) measurement to detect and quantify disease. ADC is influenced by tissue microarchitecture and may be altered in a disease state._The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation._Executed and carried through to completion._A non-ionizing radiation imaging modality for quantitative assessment of disease burden and therapy response. WB-DWI uses the apparent diffusion coefficient (ADC) measurement to detect and quantify disease. ADC is influenced by tissue microarchitecture and may be altered in a disease state.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Whole Body Diffusion-Weighted Imaging
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A non-ionizing radiation imaging modality for quantitative assessment of disease burden and therapy response. WB-DWI uses the apparent diffusion coefficient (ADC) measurement to detect and quantify disease. ADC is influenced by tissue microarchitecture and may be altered in a disease state.

Concepts.longName: Magnetic Resonance Whole Body Diffusion-Weighted Imaging
Concepts.definition: A non-ionizing radiation imaging modality for quantitative assessment of disease burden and therapy response. WB-DWI uses the apparent diffusion coefficient (ADC) measurement to detect and quantify disease. ADC is influenced by tissue microarchitecture and may be altered in a disease state.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
